intro: Endlicheria arunciflora, commonly known as the white-flowered endlicheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Endlicheria arunciflora is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
